content.translation: at once, at the same time
through c. gen.; because of c. acc.
any one, any thing, some one, some thing;
one’s father’s or mother’s sister, aunt
equal to, the same as; adv. perhaps
(such a kind) as; for οἷός τε see οἷος III.
how, that, in order that, as
from the side of, c. gen., beside, alongside of, c. dat., to the side of, motion alongside of, c. acc.
(w. gen.) from; (w. dat.) at, near, in addition to; (w. acc.) to, toward, regarding
a means of knowing, a mark, token
in, within, in the house, at home
a taking hold, seizing, catching, seizure
anything, delivered by word of mouth, word, speech
place of pasture; district (nome), esp. in Egypt
the object by which one swears, the witness of an oath
hallowed, sanctioned by the law of God
that which is one's own, one's substance, property
of what nature? of what sort?
art, skill, craft in work, cunning of hand
(living in the fields) wild, savage, harsh
one who heals, a mediciner, physician
a stroke: a sound made by striking stringed instruments
an oval-shaped stone for playing a game like our draughts
a floating vessel, a ship, vessel
that which has been done, a deed, act
grain, corn: food made from grain, bread
a viewing, perception by the senses
a turn, direction, course, way; character
of one another, to one another, one another
without the Muses, without taste, unrefined, inelegant, rude, gross
not thought on, unheard of; senseless, silly
to speak out, tell out, declare (Hom.), deny, refuse, forbid
just, observant of custom, correct, balanced
every, every one, each, each one
easily satisfied, contented with one's food
a seeking, seeking for, search for
open to sight, visible, manifest, evident
useful, good of its kind, serviceable
a piece of silver, a silver coin
want of strength, weakness, feebleness, sickliness
a deliberate resolution, purpose, design, plan
a master, lord, the master of the house
of or for a doctor, skilled in medicine, medical
a danger, risk, hazard, venture, enterprise
a by-word, common saying, proverb, maxim, saw
useful, serviceable, good for use, good, apt
necessary, forcible (subst. kin, necessities for life)
one must give back, refer, assign
in or of the country, local, native
having an eye to gain, wily, crafty, cunning
acts of communion, communications, dealings between man and man
of or for a man-at-arms, fit to serve as hoplite
one who works for the people, a skilled workman, handicraftsman
of or for a tyrant, befitting a tyrant, in favor of tyranny
the ground on which soldiers are encamped, a camp, encampment
a man in business, money-getter, trafficker
of or for democracy; favoring, suited to democracy
a cushion for the head, pillow
to take up, raise, lift up
(to be first) to rule, to begin
to set a going, put in motion
to stay at home, stay where one is, not stir
to perceive by the eyes, observe, notice
to put in quick motion: to drive, hunt, chase away
to think worthy of; to expect
to have pity on, shew mercy upon
to set in motion, to move
to be moored, lie at anchor
to prevail upon, win over, persuade
to be clearly seen, to resemble, to seem (πρέπει it is fitting)
to bring to light, make to appear
to put to flight, to terrify; mid. to fear
to rejoice, be glad, be delighted
to treat with affection, to caress, love, be fond of
not to perceive, be ignorant of
to skip in childish glee, gambol
to disable, hinder (Hom.); to harm, damage
to think, imagine, suppose, fancy, conjecture
to pay off, pay in full
cross-examine; put to the test; prove; refute
to lie; to have been set/put (as perf. pass. of τίθημι)
to make to go, carry, convey
to go to and fro, up and down, to stalk
to do a favor, to oblige, to please
to help, aid, assist, to be of use
to pick out one from another, to pick out
to carry through; be different from, excel
to be able, capable, strong enough
to bring in, to propose (a question, a law), to pay tax (εἰσφορά)
to use words of good omen
to look on, gaze at, view, behold
to procure for oneself, to get, gain, acquire
to escape notice, to be unknown, unseen, unnoticed
to make hostile, make an enemy of
to have come; to belong to, to fit
to shew by a sign, indicate, make known, point out
to bring together; impers. to benefit
be with (incl. be wife of, study with)
(with gen.) to hit the mark, to get; (with pple) to happen to, to actually
to talk nonsense, play the fool
to keep watch and ward, keep guard
to make to give light, make to blaze up
to separate, set apart; mid. answer
to learn to know, to perceive, mark, learn
to be afraid, in a fright
to scare away, startle and strike with panic, fear
(to knock out); to astound, shock, amaze
to leave behind; to run out, fail
to have or do in common with
to be a witness, to bear witness, give evidence, bear testimony
agree, say the same thing as
to be an ally, to be in alliance
to twist up into a ball
to complete, finish, accomplish; pple. finally, in the end
to forbid; to give up, renounce
to give back, give what is due; (mid.) sell
to welcome kindly, bid welcome, greet
to give from hand to hand, to pass on, hand over
to pass over; bring about, accomplish
to light upon, fall in with, meet with
to attempt, attack, put one’s hand to
to be of good repute, to be held in esteem, honoured, famous, popular
to sit down, take one's seat
to do evil, work wickedness, deal basely
to be daring, to make a venture, take the risk, do a daring thing
to transgress the law, act unlawfully
to make over to; mid. procure, pretend
to be a monarch, an absolute ruler
to be fond of victory, engage in rivalry, be contentious
to negotiate, transact business, have dealings
to wish to be delivered from
to take away, receive one’s due, cut off
cause to waste away; mid. waste away
to practise a trade, do work
to err from the mark, fail
to raise up: to make one rise
to turn about, turn round, turn
to go forward, go on, advance
to add, to apply, to close (a door); mid. to join (a group), take as an ally
take up; understand, interpret; assume; reply, rejoin
to take care of, have charge of, have the management of
to seize upon, lay hold of
to carry on war against, be at war with another
lay down under, mid. lie down, submit, yield
to have a democratical constitution, live in a democracy
to be governed by the best-born, to live under an aristocratical form of government
in truth, truly, verily, of a surety
conj. if, whether; part. w/wishes, adv. w/imperatives
just as (both pre-and postposed); w. part.: because
on, upon with gen., dat., and acc.
on the one hand, on the other hand
adv. + superl., as...as possible; ὅτι μή except
let me tell you, surely, verily
from under, by, c. gen. under, c. dat., towards c. acc.
at least then, at any rate, any way
certainly, to be sure, of course
whether..or (regardless of whether A or B)
in so far as, according as
down, against with gen.; according to, throughout with acc.
around, round about with gen., dat., and acc.
at the very place, just here, just there
on account of, for the sake of, because of, for
to be like; to look like
flesh, meat, a piece of meat
the very man who, the very thing which
long ago, in olden time, in days of yore, in time gone by
here, in this place, at this point
and indeed, and further; and yet
no more, no longer, no further
in any way whatever, in some way or other
to share in knowledge, be cognisant of
all in all, altogether, wholly, absolutely
father of Anticlea, grandfather of Odysseus
